Senator Aceh Minta Pergub 28/2019 tentang Beasiswa Direvisi
07 Nov 2019, 01:40 by Syahril Ahmad



Senator Aceh Minta Pergub 28/2019 tentang Beasiswa Direvisi



Senator Aceh Minta Pergub 28/2019 tentang Beasiswa Direvisi


KBRN, Jakarta : Sehubungan dengan program satu desa satu hafidz, senator Aceh HM Fadhil Rahmi mengapresiasi bupati simeulue. "Kita harus mendorong seluruh desa di Aceh tidak hanya di Simeulue, satu hafidz satu desa harus menjadi program prioritas Aceh, baik provinsi aupun Kabupaten/kota," ujarnya.
"Saya sebagai mantan ketua IKAT siap bantu memberikan informasi dan rekomendasi dayah2 tujuan, baik di aceh maupun luar aceh. Jaringan dan networking kita selama ini bisa kita optimalkan untuk terwujudnya program satu desa satu hafidz," kata Fadhil Rahmi, anggota Komite III DPD RI, Rabu (6/11/2019).
"Aceh adalah nanggroe syariat, wajar dan mustahak sekali program-program seperti ini harus digalakkan. Satu desa satu hafidz, satu desa satu sarjana hafidz, satu desa satu alumni Alazhar/Yamab/Timteng dan program-program sejenis lainnya. Kalo berbicara aceh carong, gemilang, madani dan sebagainya, titik beratnya adalah peningkatan kualitas SDM," ungkapnya.
Di tingkat desa, keuchiek dan perangkat desa harus alokasikan dana desa untuk beasiswa. Begitu juga di tingkat kabupaten. Lebih-lebih di tingkat provinsi. BPSDM harus jelas orientasinya.
"Alokasi dana beasiswa untuk bidang agama ke timteng tidak jelas.  Kalau ada masig sangat minim. Sistem dan jenjang pendidikan gak update. Mau dibawa kemana nanggroe syariat kalau begini?" tanya mantan Ketua IKAT ini.
“Selain Simeulue, saya juga apresiasi bupati Abdya yg mempunyai program mencetak sarjana hafidz dengan mengalokasikan dana setiap thn untuk 10 putra/putri terbaik Abdya.
"Belum tiga tahun berjalan, manfaatnya sudah nampak. Hadirnya ma'had tahfidz yang dikelola oleh alumni Alazhar di Abdya. Semoga daerah lainnya mau berbuat hal yg sama bahkan lebih," harapnya. 
Terkait BPSDM,  info dari pemberitaan media, pedoman mereka adalah Pergub 28/2019. Dari pergub itu lahir syarat penerima beasiswa. Syarat-syarat yang ada sangat diskriminatif, menyamaratakan sistem pendidikan  luar negeri.
"Padahal sistem di eropa dan timteng beda. Maka wajar yang ikut seleksi beasiswa tahfidz ke luar negeri hanya puluhan. Itupun rata-rata karena ada dispensasi/keringanan syarat. Padahal peminat dan putra-putri aceh yang memenuhi syarat lebih 500-an setiap tahun," jelasnya. 
"Sudah saya bentuk tim untuk telaah. Kalau benar diskriminatif, dan tidak mengakomodir sistem pendidikan timur tengah, Pergub kita minta direvisi. Pendidikan agama harus diutamakan dan menjadi prioritas," pungkas Fadhil Rahmi.

Aceh Senator Asks Pergub 28/2019 regarding Revised Scholarships
Nov 7 2019, 01:40 by Syahril Ahmad



Aceh Senator Asks Pergub 28/2019 regarding Revised Scholarships



Aceh Senator Asks Pergub 28/2019 regarding Revised Scholarships


KBRN, Jakarta: Regarding the one hafidz village program, Aceh senator HM Fadhil Rahmi appreciates the simeulue regent. "We must encourage all villages in Aceh not only in Simeulue, one hafidz for one village must be a priority program for Aceh, both provincial and district / city," he said.
"I, as a former IKAT chairman, is ready to help provide information and recommendations for day-to-day objectives, both in Aceh and outside Aceh. We can optimize our network and networking for the realization of the one hafidz one village program," said Fadhil Rahmi, member of Committee III DPD RI, Wednesday (6/11/2019).
"Aceh is a nanggroe syariah, it is natural and absolutely imperative that programs like this should be promoted. One village hafidz, one village one hafidz scholar, one village one Alazhar / Yamab / Middle East alumni and other similar programs. If speaking aceh carong, brilliant, madani and so on, the emphasis is on improving the quality of human resources, "he said.
At the village level, keuchiek and village officials must allocate village funds for scholarships. Likewise at the district level. Especially at the provincial level. BPSDM must have a clear orientation.
"The allocation of scholarship funds for the religious field to the Middle East is unclear. If there is still a minimum, the education system and levels are not updated. What do you want to bring to the Shari'a if this is the case?" asked the former IKAT Chairperson.
"In addition to Simeulue, I also appreciate Abdya regent who has a program to produce bachelor hafidz by allocating funds every year for the 10 best sons and daughters of Abdya.
"Not yet three years running, the benefits have been seen. The presence of Ma'had Tahfidz which is managed by Alazhar alumni in Abdya. Hopefully other regions will do the same even more," he hoped.
Related to BPSDM, info from media coverage, their guideline is Pergub 28/2019. From the regulation, the scholarship recipient was born. The conditions are very discriminatory, equalizing the foreign education system.
"Whereas the system in Europe and Middle East is different. So it is only natural to take part in the selection of Tahfidz scholarships abroad only in dozens. And even then, on average, there are dispensation / relief conditions. Even though interested ones and sons and daughters of Aceh who meet the requirements of more than 500 each year, "he explained.
"I have formed a team to study. If it is truly discriminatory, and does not accommodate the Middle East education system, we ask for the revised Pergub. Religious education must be prioritized and become a priority," concluded Fadhil Rahmi.
